quest.name: Shock and Awe
journal: The terrified refugee would have you find his brethren and convince them to lay down their arms.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to the terrified refugee in Lost Hope.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.

Though you came to make an example of the twins, the refugees refuse to stand aside. Only after you subdue five of their number do the sellswords appear. Fortunately, their defeat seems to have had the desired effect. Speak with the desperate refugee, and confirm that he has taken your lesson to heart.
The refugee falls to his knees in despair, his will to fight broken. Inform the survivor in Lost Hope of all that has transpired.

Though saddened to learn that his comrades forced your hand, the survivor is grateful for your intervention. He is, however, concerned that the merchant will attempt to recruit more desperate refugees, perpetuating the bloodshed. Recalling that the merchant wished to approach the people of Stonesthrow, the survivor bids you continue your search there.

You find yourself drawn to a sobbing child, who tells you of a man who visited Stonesthrow and persuaded a number of people, including her parents, to leave with him. The child's account strongly suggests that it was the selfsame merchant who visited Lost Hope, but it offers no clue as to his current whereabouts. Return to the Hall of Flames in Ul'dah and share your findings with Commander Swift.

Commander Swift is full glad to hear that you convinced the refugees of Lost Hope to lay down their arms. That joy soon gives way to anger as you share the revelation that a single merchant has influenced recent events so greatly. The high flame commander declares that the merchant must be apprehended at once; doubtless he desires your help in this endeavor.

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: The other refugees are hiding in the caves south of Lost Hope, but to approach them would be fruitless. They would sooner call us agents of the sultanate and try to kill us than listen to reason. Why, the twins might even deign to do the deed themselves.

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: A pox on all bloody sellswords! They were supposed to train us to fight, but the ones he sent with us vanished during the struggle.

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: Oh, if only we had never listened to that merchant's ridiculous claims! He said our cause was righteous, that the gods would never suffer us to be defeated─

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: Though, if they were forced to confront reality... That's it! Challenge the twins to combat and show my brethren that their strongest warriors are no match for one womanman! Mayhap then they will agree to lay down their arms and renounce this plot!

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: Hurt the twins if you must, but pray do your utmost not to harm the others.

dialogue.name: REFUGEE01444
dialogue.text: Seven hells, they've found us! Everyone, grab yer gear and make for the rendezvous point!

dialogue.name: REFUGEE01444
dialogue.text: ...So that's yer game, is it? Ahahaha! Sorry to disappoint ye, lasslad, but we're more than willin' to kill ye ourselves!

dialogue.name: REFUGEE01444
dialogue.text: Ye beat 'em like it was nothin'! Thal almighty, what are we gonna do now...?

dialogue.name: REFUGEE01444
dialogue.text: We yield, all right!? We yield! That's what ye wanted, ain't it!? So go away and leave us be!

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: You've returned! Did you find my brethren? What of the twins? What happened!?

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: I see... Well...you had no choice. Better that a handful of them take a beating from you than the lot get butchered by the Flames.

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: Tell me, what did the merchant have to say when it was over?

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: Huh? But where else would he be? Unless... Unless he went to Stonesthrow to recruit others?

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: As I recall, he wished to approach the refugees there as well, but was waiting until the Flames withdrew their forces from the vicinity. And now that they have, there's nothing to stop him from continuing his work.

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: How many more must perish in pursuit of this futile cause? How much more suffering must we endure before it ends?

dialogue.name: TREMBLEMAN01443
dialogue.text: Find him. Convince him to cease his mad quest. It will surely lead us to ruin.

dialogue.name: ELE
dialogue.text: <sniffle> Have... Have you seen my parents?

dialogue.name: ELE
dialogue.text: They told me to stay here with the others. <sniffle> They said they'd be back soon, but it's been days...

dialogue.name: ELE
dialogue.text: They left with the man from Ul'dah. The man said they were gonna change everything─make it so we could live inside the walls with everyone else. I liked it when he said that.

dialogue.name: ELE
dialogue.text: I didn't like it when he talked about making the rich people pay. Everyone looked so angry, and I got scared...

dialogue.name: ELE
dialogue.text: Lots of people left with the man after that, but no one's come back... <sniffle> <sob>

dialogue.name: ELE
dialogue.text: Mother... Father... <sniffle> <sob>

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: Welcome back, [GC Rank] SurnameForename. Have you learned aught of interest?

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: You persuaded a gang of refugees to lay down their arms? The Flame General will be pleased to learn of this!

dialogue.name: SWIFT
dialogue.text: Less so, these other revelations. We must apprehend this treasonous snake at once!

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: A chorus of cries echoes throughout the cavern...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Help me, dammit!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: You should never have come here!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: W-We can take herhim!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: I c-can't do this alone!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Do yer worst!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: <huff> <puff>

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text:
You won't stop us!
You can't stop us!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Ho, a challenge!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: It's been too long!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Meddlesome wretch!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: BitchBastard!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Enough!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: No, NO!
